_header: I have heard many men make their moan

HunHM906.Transcription:
I haue hard many men make their mone that lawyers frendlye weare to
                    nonebut whether yt be true or noit is not lawfull to saye
                    so
HunHM906.Note:
Added by a hand of the sixteenth century to a book of Statutes; written
                    as prose; with Latin ‘Causidici certant certant et ad huc sub indice
                        lis est’ above.
HunHM906.Editions:
Hanna,  Ralph,
                        ed.  
             “The Index of Middle English Verse and Huntington Library Collections: A
                Checklist of Addenda.” 
             Publications of the Bibliographical Society of America
         74 (1980): 235-58: 243.
